captions.text: We almost died, at the hands of a witch.
But that past made us stronger.
We'd gotten the taste of blood, witch blood.
And this is my brother Hansel.

I'm not going to have you telling me what
to do.
How do you best kill a witch?
Cutting off the head tends to work.

The last two weeks, we have five children
taken from us.
They don't come out in the open like that.
I don't think we're hunting witches.
There's something else going on here.
We have to find those kids.
I see you got my invitation.

title: Hansel and Gretel: Witch Hunters Official Trailer #1 (2012) - Jeremy Renner, Gemma Arterton Movie HD

Batman.﻿

comments.author: FantasyGirl365

comments.text:
Ha!  Hilariously bad!  Modern weapons in ... what year was this?  No 
explanation how they got them.  They fight with modern hand-to-hand combat 
techniques.  Hansel runs around in skin tight leather pants, and no one 
calls her out on it.  The troll kills five or six villagers and no one 
mentions them again, though their families were surely going hungry.  They 
didn't speak with accents, they used modern phraseology and modern lingo. 
 Hansel's repeating crossbow has a setting that makes it fire one arrow to 
the left and one to the right - because such a thing is so useful in 
situations where you are suddenly confronted with a witch on each side of 
you but none in front of you - which I'm sure happens about once per week. 
 Anyway, if such a situation just so happens, make sure the witches line up 
exactly right so they can both be simultaneously shot even though you're 
not looking at either of them.﻿
comments.author: Hogen Mogen

comments.text:
+Hogen Mogen Thanks for the synopsis. I have one more question. What is 
your take of films set in a post apocalyptic world? Do you like them?
comments.author: Jane Beanette

comments.text:
+Jane Beanette I thought it was laughable. If you want a movie that you can 
laugh *at*, not always *with*, then go ahead and take the plunge and invest 
your hour and a half in this homage to inane blood splatter, which has as 
much to do with the Hansel and Gretel fairy tale as Charlie's Angels had to 
do with law enforcement. Replay value very low. I know I'd never see it 
again on purpose.


One big problem with liking this movie is that it isn't unique or special 
in any way. It specializes in slick but silly action and tossing off one 
liners, but there are many movies that do the same. There are no genuine 
heartfelt moments, no real character development, no complexity in the 
characters. For example, Heath Ledger's Joker was an outstanding character, 
as was Nolan's Batman. Robert Downey Jr. was born to play Tony Stark. Not 
enough blood? Check Quentin Tarantino's D'jango ("The 'D' is SILENT, 
motherfucker!!"), Inglorious Basterds and especially Pulp Fiction; all of 
which have excellent characters, dialogue, and a whole lot of blood. I may 
watch a sloppily made movie like Hansel & Gretel, but I wouldn't waste time 
watching it again when I can watch some other slapped together claptrap in 
hopes that it is a diamond in the rough.
comments.author: Hogen Mogen

comments.text: +MrKlausbaudelaire I'll check out Hellsing. I just got the name HELL-SING!
comments.author: Jane Beanette

comments.text:
+Jane Beanette
hehe yup, torrent all the waaaaaay. And I meant Django, my bad xD (Django: 
Tarantino at his best) and Hellsing Ultimate, that anime. (an anime about 
vampires, follow the OVAs, they are 13 episodes that follow the manga 
perfectly to the end).
comments.author: MrKlausbaudelaire

comments.text:
+MrKlausbaudelaire "folder"!? Did you download. Naughty. What is "Jango"?
Hellsing the animation?
comments.author: Jane Beanette

comments.text:
+Jane Beanette
yea, I think it has a replay value. The acting is actualy good, the script 
doesn't cut to one-liners or bad jokes, but some pretty shocking lines when 
you set yourself in that time period. The design of the witches is just 
GREAT, they look scary, but not with clichê makeup, but each looks unique 
on their own aspects, some even bordering a God of War design.

I did watch H&G twice, and yea, I still keep this movie in my folder to 
watch again =) Its as silly as maybe Jango, but darker. Bloody as an 
episode of Hellsing Ultimate, but it doesn't TRY to disturb you, the blood 
and gore blend well in the pace of the movie.
comments.author: MrKlausbaudelaire

comments.text:
+MrKlausbaudelaire I don't like IMDb. 90% of films are given 7.0 - 7.9 
rating. It's as if most people are afraid to give a film a really low score 
or a really high one.
Doest H&G have replay value, could you watch it more than once?

Ahh, I see. What other films would you recommend?
comments.author: Jane Beanette

comments.text:
+Jane Beanette
I'd say thumbs 45º up xD but well, its a 6.1 on IMDB, so its not THAT bad, 
but its not a great movie. I like movies that are good, with a well-written 
script and acting, but once in a while I like to sit back and enjoy 
mindless gore, call that a guilty pleasure.
comments.author: MrKlausbaudelaire

comments.text:
+MrKlausbaudelaire
So, it's a thumbs up from you then.

if you like a movie that glorifies blood and gore to the point it gets 
funny, some nice character developtment (yes, the characters in this movie 
do get some good developtment) good visuals and some hilarious 
anti-climatic scenes, yea, give it a try, its like a Tarantino movie.
comments.author: MrKlausbaudelaire

comments.text: +Hogen Mogen So, is it worth seeing or not?
comments.author: Jane Beanette

comments.text:
+Hogen Mogen
because sometimes the director and producers don't care for the plot, and 
we have to deal with it until the movie is out. After the critics, the 
director wll see his mistakes and hopefuly make the announced sequel 
better. For instance, see the movie Django, by Tarantino. The acting was 
good, the blood and violence was over-the-top hilarious, but the plot had 
more holes than the moon! But people still like it.
comments.author: MrKlausbaudelaire

comments.text:
+MrKlausbaudelaire My question is why does it have to be "mindless"?  As 
long as they're going though the trouble of making the movie, why not do 
that extra bit of effort to make the plot something laudable with a great 
story?  Why spend millions making a ridiculous movie, then spend millions 
promoting it as "Look at how we suck!"  Yes, I laughed at the movie.  I 
laughed at the times when they pulled out yet another impossible weapon or 
made some other impossible shot.  I laughed at the fact that there are some 
lowbrow clods that would think these things are cool.  The movie was 
hilariously bad.
comments.author: Hogen Mogen

comments.text:
+Mike Kolokowsky
yea, but just like Kingsman, we do need, once in a while, a movie thats 
just mindless gore and unnecessary blood, you know, to have a good laugh 
and don't forget that movie so easily. Of course, Kingsman had a MUCH more 
elaborated writting and amazing acting, but some people dislikes the 
amounts of blood and gore, while others, like me, LOVED it. WHich is pretty 
much the difference between Kingsman and 007 or Hansel and Gretel and, lets 
see...Van Hellsing.
comments.author: MrKlausbaudelaire

comments.text:
+MrKlausbaudelaire I do like steampunk.  Well, just the Victorian corsets, 
actually.  The rest is ok.  If you like steampunk, you shouldn't want the 
brand tarnished by crap like this, though.  Back in the early 80s, I 
watched some dragon movie.  My friend pointed out that the armor was 300 
years too advanced for the year that they quoted.  The enemy army was 
wearing Germanic armor, but they were English.  See, I thought the director 
was just using whatever props were left over from another movie with a 
presumably better budget, hoping no one would notice, but oh, no, it was 
the invention of steampunk!  Ooh, maybe I should have bothered to remember 
the name, even.  I'm sure a shrine should have been erected to this guy who 
created the genre.  Or, invoking Occam's razor, he was just a schlock movie 
director like I thought.
comments.author: Mike Kolokowsky

comments.text:
to be fair, anything modern-ish thats out of it's own time, is what we call 
"Steampunk". and who doesnt LOVE some steampunk =D?
comments.author: MrKlausbaudelaire

comments.text:
+Hogen Mogen its funny how you make it out like he's saying things that he 
hasn't then continue to argue against those things, if your going to make 
an argument against something someone has said make sure they've actually 
said it. also its a movie, whether its good or not is completely relative 
to someones personal opinion so you can't just state that it is bad like 
your opinion of it is fact, I'm sure that most people enjoyed it because 
they're capable of understanding the fact its not set in our universe. also 
of course theres going to be meaning in the lord of the rings series, the 
books are based off of christianity, go read the books and narnia and come 
back and say you can't find any religious references in there.
comments.author: Zatha

comments.text:
+Hogen Mogen

Nope, I only enjoyed this one, because it was actually funny and good 
enough. I get it, you don't like this movie, and I did so you shouldn't 
waste more time replying about a stupid movie lol. If you think I would 
spend money on this, you are wrong. I just torrent them lol.
comments.author: ShadzWins

comments.text:
+ShadzWins I'm sure you watched and thoroughly enjoyed Abraham Lincoln: 
Vampire Hunter.  I'm sure you're waiting with anxious beads of sweat for 
Queen Victoria: Demon Hunter.  How about
Red Riding Hood: Werewolf Hunter
George Washington: Mummy Hunter
Little Miss Muffet: Spider Hunter
Mahatma Ghandi: Rakshasa Hunter
Winston Churchill:  Frankenstein Hunter
In case you're not sensing a formula, you find a person in history, real or 
fictitious, pair them with some evil or bad sounding thing to hunt.  Create 
a preposterous action movie around it.  Cash in from gullible movie goers 
who think that people blowing up like watermelons loaded with nitroglycerin 
makes for great cinema.  Make a sequel or three.  Buy another yacht.
comments.author: Hogen Mogen

comments.text:
+ShadzWins Well, I guess you've totally convinced me now.  Hansel and 
Gretel: Witch Hunters is the greatest movie ever because its steampunking 
American accented medeival Germans were so dumb funny that they won a HUGE 
award (tied for 3rd place Fangoria Chainsaw award for "best makeup").  Yes, 
best movie of all time, makes Citizen Kane look like shit.  Movies are best 
when they know that the premise is so asinine that no good movie could 
possibly be made, so why bother?  Yes, in fact "Why bother?" should be the 
motto of every movie!  It will absolutely make perfect movies every time. 
 Thank you, ShadzWins, for convincing me of the wonders of this new style 
of entertainment.  Without you, I could never have appreciated true 
stupidity as an art form.  I'd congratulate you more, but I'm overdue for a 
lobotomy, which will only increase my newfound passion towards 
cinema-sans-IQ.
comments.author: Hogen Mogen

comments.text:
Honestly, i like the movie, love the idea, and ADORE the actors! :) Yes, I 
am pretty sure that the script could have been made better, but sometimes i 
just LOVED the swearing or sass that just so happened to be in the exact 
right places. Sure, it could be better by actually making the movie a 
little longer, but really, it was worth it. If you like violence and gore, 
this is a movie for ya ;) Don't judge a book OR movie by its cover, lol. 
Gemma Arterton (along with Jeremy Renner) is brilliant in any sense of way 
for me in all their movies.﻿

1h 18min is way too short for any movie... young inexperienced director who 
didn't realize that the script needed some improvements... too much blood 
splatter and excessive violence... great sceneries... the troll was a 
awesome... great cast except Jeremy Renner who didn't fit this role, Famke 
Janssen was awesome as always... didn't like the prosthetic makup on the 
witches, overdone and ridiculous in some cases... all in all this movie is 
one of those ''could have been great''... but nevertheless actually felt a 
bit entertained afterwards, rented for a buck so didn't feel bamboozled!﻿

characters(Mina death scene wasn't all that dramatic) and

the world, talk more about the Trolls and witches relationship, what the
